info.name: Corpay Cross-Border API Documentation v1.8
info.description:
Corpay Cross-Border API uses HATEOAS (Hypertext As The Engine Of Application State) framework. This means all response copy with and element `links`. This provides a link on the current resource as well as all actions that can be taken from there. Response to APIs, once authenticated, are displayed in the following model ``` javascript { "content": {}, "errors": [], "links": [ { "rel": "self", "uri": "https://crossborder.corpay.com/api/{endpoint}}", "method": {POST GET or PUT} } ] } ``` where content and errors are provided in the appropriate lists. Links always contain a `SELF` link to the current endpoint, and any additional links, depending on the state of the resource. For example a beneficiary object can be viewed and modified. # Release Notes Corpay Cross-Border's suite of API services and functionality is continuously growing in which we deploy multiple releases throughout the year. To discover what's new with Corpay's API, you can read our [What's New](https://apidocscrossborder.corpay.com/#7cf5b90c-3b0b-4ca8-9c3b-b4a8cc51e4a3) section that detail the most recent API enhancements and updates. # Common Terms
  • Client Code - A unique 6-digit client identifier for each client account. Used in all endpoints as part of URL.
  • Partner ID - Links multiple client accounts together. Used during authentication procedure.
  • Payment - Outgoing cashflow to a beneficiary.
  • Settlement - Incoming cashflow to Corpay.
# Base URL The documentation for each endpoint displays the HTTP method and the end path. Before you submit the request, you need to prepend the base path to get the full resource URL. All endpoints referenced in the documentation require the following base path: [https://crossborder.corpay.com](https://crossborder.corpay.com). **Note:** Depending on the stage of your implementation, the base path may be slightly different. For staging, pre-production, QA, and testing, use [https://crossborder.beta.corpay.com](https://crossborder.beta.corpay.com) to point to the Beta environment. Curly braces are used as a placeholder and indicate the type of value that you need to supply. For instance, where you see {clientCode} in the resource, you need to replace that string with your client code. For example, in the documentation, endpoints look similar to this: `GET /api/{clientCode}/0/benes/{beneID}` When you add the base path, your client code, and any parameters, the result is a well-formed REST URL that looks something like this: `GET https://crossborder.corpay.com/api/123456/0/benes/jsmith321` # Response Codes Most of the endpoints include examples for both successful and unsuccessful responses. In the Example Request, click the downward arrow beside the response code to view additional examples. Corpay Cross-Border uses conventional HTTP response codes to indicate the success or failure of an API request.
Response CodeDescription
2xx
Success.
4xx

Client error. This is usually due to missing or incorrect information, for example, a missing or incorrect parameter or value.

  • 401 - Authorization issue. This usually means that the authorization token has expired and you need to refresh it.

  • 410 - Rate resource expired. Due to currency fluctations, quotes are valid for a very limited period of time. When you get a 410 error, it means that the rate resource you're trying to use has expired and you need to generate a new quote.

5xx
Server error. If the error persists, contact Corpay Tier 2 support.

item.name: What's New
August 2024
item.description:
#### Release Date: August 16, 2024

- We updated the [Mass Payments Quote](https://apidocscrossborder.corpay.com/#f270a6e2-a6c4-4e6a-973e-de5702fc5e4e) endpoint to return the `trackerId` in the response. With this update, our partners can retrieve the `trackerId` in the Mass Payment workflow immediately and avoid subsequent follow-up API requests to retrieve the payment tracker IDs.
    

#### Release Date: August 02, 2024

- We updated the [Partner ](https://apidocscrossborder.corpay.com/#232a15a1-71d3-4dda-bad6-a232bb5a3a05) and [Client](https://apidocscrossborder.corpay.com/#3959a591-17e0-42ce-b2e8-fc8dba548bc5) level token endpoints to return a 400 HTTPS error for null or invalid form data, instead of the previously returned 500 error. This update improves error handling.

item.name: 2023 Updates
October 2023
item.description:
#### Release Date: October 02, 2023

- Added new **Push Notifications via Webhooks** to allow our Partners to receive real-time notifications on events that occur within their client account and eliminates the need to regularly poll the APIs to know if there is a new update. Webhooks utilize an event-driven approach to promptly send a notification when the subscribed event occurs.
    
- The Push Notifications are currently available for **Payment** and **Client Onboarding** events. For more information, see [Webhooks](https://apidocscrossborder.corpay.com/#420918fd-2014-430a-b7ed-95137afd4c5c).

item.name: August 2023
item.description:
**Update Date: August 26, 2023**

Corpay’s `POST` **Accept Terms** API endpoint is deprecated as of **August 26th, 2023**.

To streamline our Forward workflow and reduce the number of endpoints that need to be called to successfully complete a Forward order, the `POST` **Accept Terms** API endpoint for the v1.8 suite is made obsolete as of the advised date.

Partner’s are no longer required to send an ‘Accept Terms’ API request and instead, will complete their Forward booking with the existing `POST` [Complete Order](https://apidocscrossborder.corpay.com/#81659262-9e89-4ffd-b8a7-138d3789c755) API endpoint.

item.name: May 2023
item.description:
#### Release Date: May 26, 2023

- Added new **authentication API** to allow partners to securely access the **Secret Keys** for a newly onboarded client. This API will return an encrypted response containing the **ClientCode**, **AuthSecret**, and **UserNames** linked to the onboarded client. For more information, see `GET` [AuthSecret Keys](https://apidocscrossborder.corpay.com/#1021510e-2d4e-416d-bc2b-2e476e835c17).

item.name: March 2023
item.description:
#### Release Date: March 31, 2023

- Added new pickListType **NatureOfBusiness** to the client onboarding picklists API. This pickListType will return a predefined list of nature of business values and further expedite the client onboarding process. For more information, see [Onboarding Picklists](https://apidocscrossborder.corpay.com/#1655c1ed-d585-487d-ba7f-ffda488976d5).  
    **Note**: This list returns possible values that you can pass in the NatureOfBusiness field. You can enter any valid string value for this field.

item.name: February 2023
item.description:
#### Release Date: February 20, 2023

- Added new [Onboarding endpoints](https://apidocscrossborder.corpay.com/#f7f89960-e0e2-4030-a402-1b57bd881023) to allow our Partners to submit a corporate client onboarding request. On successful submission of the request a unique `clientOnboardingId` is returned. They can then submit the required verification documents via the [Submit Onboarding](https://apidocscrossborder.corpay.com/#c9b83495-8099-46bc-82e1-a7aba3f4f9bd) request to complete the onboarding process for that client.

item.name: January 2023
item.description:
#### Release Date: January 16, 2023

- Added new [Payment Tracking](https://apidocscrossborder.corpay.com/#f12309ad-bbed-4b79-8476-038d2ff519bf) endpoints to allow our Partners to trace the details and status of their payments. This feature is available only for SWIFT Payments - Wires. EFT/iACH payments are currently not supported. For more information, see `GET` [Payment Tracking.](https://apidocscrossborder.corpay.com/#f12309ad-bbed-4b79-8476-038d2ff519bf)
- Added a new field `trackerId` in the `POST Instruct Deal` and `GET Lookup Orders` response. This field will return the unique `trackerId` for a specific payment that can be used to trace the payment details and status. For more information, see `POST` [Instruct Deal](https://apidocscrossborder.corpay.com/#f78752cf-6adf-4427-85a4-69dbc1288bc1) and `GET` [Lookup Orders](https://apidocscrossborder.corpay.com/#a3fc0756-d92c-48a9-9cc2-22ae872468a1).
Updates introduced in 2023.
This section provides information about any bug fixes and enhancements introduced with a release for Corpay API.

item.name: 2-Token Auth

request.description:
Sample payload for the JWT token generation:

```
{
"iss": "test",
"iat": 1480103915,
"exp": 1480105116,
"aud": "cambridgefx",
"sub": ""
}

```

[This link](http://jwtbuilder.jamiekurtz.com/) has a form to generate JWT token.

For the token, you must be current between the window of the issue and the expiry (`iat` and `exp`, respectively) of the Unix-Timestamp.

##### IMPLEMENTATION NOTES:

*   Algorithm has to be HS256.
*   Assertion needs to regenerated as it has expiry time.
*   Assertion value is an encoded JWT token that contain security key provided by Corpay.
*   `iss` is the Corpay-provided partner ID.

response.name: 400 'exp' set too far in the future
400 JWT token is expired
400 login form input data not supplied

request.description:
The authentication on the Client-level is similar to the authentication process at the partner-level. Two key differences in the JWT construction:
  • access_code from Partner Auth goes in the header of this API.
  • API username is the `iss` in the JWT token.
The `access_code` granted at the Client-level will be the session token for all subsequent calls in the current user session. Expiry of the `access_code` can accomodate different use cases.

response.name: 400 erroneous Client-level Token Login
400 login form input data not supplied

item.description:
Our RESTful API suite employs an OAuth2 framework which consists of a two part flow that involves exchanging a HS256-signed JWT token for a “CMG-AccessToken”. The partner-level and the client-level work in the following way: Given “Issuer” - either the name of the Partner or the Client (contained in the Claim Set) - and the Signature, you create an encoded JWT Token (hashed via HS256); which is inserted into the body of the request of this call (in the "assertion" field). When creating the token, the "issued-at" and the "expiration" should be current, and advisably set apart at an interval of 20 minutes, respectively. Once the call is placed, the response provides an "access_code" which will be submitted to the "CMG-AccessToken" field in the header of the subsequent (Client-Level) requests. Since there is no call preceding partner-level, there is no need to pass anything through "CMG-AccessToken" for the partner-level. --- ##### AUTHENTICATION ERRORS
Error CodeDescription
400 Bad Request - Invalid value for audience
JWT audience (aud) value of 'cambridgefx' was expected. Make sure that the audience ("aud") is set to "cambridgefx" (in the JWT claimset)
400 Bad Request - 'exp' token is set too far into the future
This error is the result of setting the token too far into the future. The threshold is approximately 24 hours after issue.
400 Bad Request - Invalid Issuer (either Partner or User)
User not found or partner access not configured. Check the "error_description" parameter for more information.
400 Bad Request - Invalid signature key
The auth key or signature must be current; otherwise the token will not be signed properly.
400 Bad Request - JWT Token is expired
As a general rule, use 'time + 20 minutes' as your expiry date/time.

item.name: Beneficiary Workflow
Beneficiary Core

request.description:
This endpoint specifies the information needed to create a beneficiary in a particular country. (See `POST` [Create/Edit Bene](https://apidocscrossborder.corpay.com/#36685106-4a23-48e8-b518-d98d869dbc85)) The URL is a query string that requires five parameters to obtain all the information needed to create the beneficiary:

  • 'destinationCountry': ISO2 country code

  • 'bankCountry': ISO2 country code

  • 'bankCurrency': ISO3 currency code

  • 'classification': 'Business' or 'Individual'

  • 'paymentMethods': 'W'- Wire, 'E' - iACH

**Note:** If you don't include all five parameters in the URL, the 'provide' element in the response will display any missing information. If 'provide' is an empty array, that means that no additional data is needed. In other words, not providing all five parameters will not result in an error. If successful, the response contains a list of the fields required to successfully create a beneficiary. These rules are guidelines for the payload of the `POST` [Create/Edit Bene](https://apidocscrossborder.corpay.com/#36685106-4a23-48e8-b518-d98d869dbc85) endpoint.

response.name: 200 Beneficiary Rules

request.description:
The 'clientIntegrationId' value is a unique beneficiary ID that you can use in other endpoints. The first time it is provided, it creates a new resource, which is later used to reference that beneficiary. The 'clientIntegrationId' must be unique as Corpay uses global values in this field. **Note:** The only characters allowed in the 'clientIntegrationId' are: - Alphanumeric (a-zA-Z0-9) - Dash (-) - Underscore (_) You can use GUID which has a very low chance of collision, your own hash, or some determinstic prefix to make it unique. Changing the 'clientIntegrationId' creates a new beneficiary template. **Note:** The only special characters allowed in the accountHolder name and address fields, and the bank name and address fields are: - Period (.) - Comma (,) - Ampersand (&) - Dash (-) In the following table, unless otherwise noted, **required** means that the field is required for _ALL_ beneficiaries, regardless of destination. Some destinations require additional information. --- ##### REQUEST BODY
ParameterDescription
accountHolderName
string (required)
Full name of the account holder.

Maximum 100 characters.
templateIdentifier
string (required)
The client-assigned template identifier. This value should match the 'clientIntegrationId' in the URL. The value in this field is returned in the 'beneIdentifier' field when you run GET View Bene.

Maximum 50 characters.
destinationCountry
string (required)
Two-letter ISO code for the country where the beneficiary's bank is located.
bankCurrency
string (required)
Three-letter ISO code for the bank account currency.
classification
string (required)
Beneficiary classification = 'Individual' or 'Business'. Most of the other values shown in GET Beneficiary Rules.
paymentMethods

array (required)
Methods of payment that can be used for this beneficiary = ['W' or 'E']

  • 'W' = Wire

  • 'E' = EFT

preferredMethod
string (required)
Method of payment preferred by this beneficiary.
accountNumber
string (required)
Bank account number.
localAccountNumber
string (optional)
Bank account number.
routingCode
string (required for Wires)
Bank routing code - used to identify a specific financial institution. In some countries, the routing code is known by another name, such as ABA Number, Transit Number, Sort Code, BSB Number, IFSC Code, or Branch Code.
localRoutingCode
string (optional)
Bank routing code.
accountHolderCountry
string (required)
The account holder's two-letter ISO country code.
accountHolderRegion
string (required for Canada and the United States)
The account holder's province or state.

Maximum 30 characters.
accountHolderAddress1
string (required)
First line of the account holder's address.

Maximum 50 characters.
accountHolderAddress2
string (optional)
Second line of the account holder's address.

Maximum 50 characters.
accountHolderCity
string (required)
The account holder's city.

Maximum 100 characters.
accountHolderPostal
string (required for Canada or the United States)
The account holder's postal or zip code.

Maximum 50 characters.
accountHolderPhoneNumber
integer (required)
The account holder's phone number.
accountHolderEmail
string (required if 'SendPayTracker' = 'true')
Email address.
sendPayTracker
boolean (optional)
Specifies whether to send an email alert to the beneficiary whenever a payment is released = ['true', 'false'].
swiftBicCode
string (required for Wires)
The unique identifier for the bank or financial institution.
bankName
string (required)
Name of the financial institution.

Maximum 250 characters.
bankCountry
string (required)
The bank's two-letter ISO country code.
bankRegion
string (required for Canada or the United States)
The bank's province or state.

Maximum 100 characters.
bankCity
string (required)
The bank's city.

Maximum 100 characters.
bankAddressLine1
string (required)
First line of the bank's address.

Maximum 100 characters.
bankAddressLine2
string (optional)
Second line of the bank's address.

Maximum 100 characters.
bankPostal
string (required for Canada or the United States)
The bank's postal or zip code.

Maximum 50 characters.
paymentReference
string (optional)
Default payment reference that will be used if a reference is not provided on a payment. The payment reference is transmitted with the payment, subject to banking constraints.
internalPaymentAlert
string (optional)
Internal email addresses to notify when a payment is made to this beneficiary.
externalPaymentAlert
string (optional)
External email addresses to notify when a payment is made to this beneficiary.
regulatory
array (required if mandatory for destination country)
The fields and corresponding values needed to satisfy regulatory requirements for the destination country.
##### RESPONSE BODY
ParameterDescription
content.templateId
The id that is used to reference the most recent iteration of a beneficiary template (since the template is mutable, it generates a new id everytime there is a change); this string is used in the POST Instruct Deal call in the 'beneficiaryId' field.
##### CREATE/EDIT BENE ERRORS
Error CodeDescription
400 Bad Request - Value provided doesn't match the RegEx
The value in the specified field does not contain the required number of characters or contains characters that are not allowed.
400 Bad Request - Field is mandatory
One or more required field values are missing.
400 Bad Request - Value provided is not in the set of valid values
The value provided is not an allowed value for the specified field.
400 Bad Request - Beneficiary Identifier has already been assigned
The 'templateIdentifier' already exists and cannot be used again.

request.description:
This endpoint permanently deletes a single beneficiary. You cannot delete more than one beneficiary at the same time.

**Important:** After you delete a beneficiary, it cannot be viewed or reactivated.

This endpoint retrieves a list of all your bene templates that meet the specified criteria. See "Employ Query String" below. These parameters will assist in narrowing your search. --- ##### EMPLOY QUERY STRING To perform a parameterized search, use one or more of these parameters in the query string:
ParameterDescriptionExample
q=CurrThe ISO-4217 Currency Code/api/{clientCode}/0/benes?q=Curr:EUR
q=PayeeCountryISOThe ISO2 Country Code/api/{clientCode}/0/benes?q=PayeeCountryISO:AD
q=Methods

The method of payment = ['W' or 'E']

  • 'W' = Wire

  • 'E' = EFT

/api/{clientCode}/0/benes?q=Methods:E
q=StatusThe status of the benficiary template - 'Active', or 'Inactive' = ['A' or 'I']/api/{clientCode}/0/benes?q=Status:A

url.raw: /api/banks?country={country ISO2}&query={search string}&skip={number of objects to skip; optional}&take={number of objects to retrieve; optional}

request.description:
This call searches a database of global banks and returns results that meet your search criteria.  
The query parameters can be any relevant information, such as name, city, routing code, etc.

There are two optional parameters that you can include in the query string: 'take' specifies how many results you want returned, and 'skip' specifies how many search results you want to skip. For very broad search results, we recommend that you use 'take' and 'skip' to minimize page load times.

response.name: 200 OK

request.description:
Validates the IBAN number submitted in the ‘Body’ of the request, and returns the banking details parsed from the IBAN string. Response provides two important data points:
  • Whether the IBAN is valid.
  • Bank information. This is not contingent on valid structure of the IBAN.
**Note:** IBAN can be invalid but bank information can still be extracted.

item.description:
These endpoints assist with the creation and lookup of beneficiary information.

IBAN Validation is recommended for use in IBAN enabled countries, while Bank Search is for countries that do not support IBAN.
The endpoints in this section are used to create functional beneficiary templates that comply with all country-specific regulatory requirements.

item.name: Spot Workflow

request.description:
This is the first of two calls that are used to book a live rate as part of a Spot transaction. This call creates an impermanent resource based on a live exchange rate (between a currency pair). In order to secure the rate, you must book the deal (`POST` [Book Deal](https://apidocscrossborder.corpay.com/#3bc872ce-26ad-45cb-8b70-b0a1e7e58434)). The lockside determines which side of the pair will carry the base amount. For example, for a CAD/USD spot deal, if lockside is set to the 'payment' currency (which in this case is USD), then the quoted amount will be the 'settlement' currency (or CAD in this case). As market rates are in flux, this quote may expire before you book the deal. By default, the rate expires in 10 seconds. The quote resource is in the response header under 'Location'. This URL is the precursor to executing the `POST` [Book Deal](https://apidocscrossborder.corpay.com/#3bc872ce-26ad-45cb-8b70-b0a1e7e58434) endpoint. **Note:** Corpay maintains a list of all available currencies, and ranks them from major to minor. This ranking is internal to Corpay and does not reflect any industry standard ordering. The internal ranking determines how the values for the 'rateType' and 'operation' parameters are expressed in the response. * * * ##### REQUEST BODY
ParameterDescription
paymentCurrencystring (required)
The three-letter ISO code for the payment currency.
settlementCurrencystring (required)
The three-letter ISO code for the settlement currency.
amountnumber (required)
The amount on which to base the quote.
lockSidestring (required)
Indicates which currency to lock when the rate calculation is performed = ['payment', 'settlement'].
##### RESPONSE BODY
ParameterDescription
content.rate.valueThe result of applying the 'operation' type to the 'lockside' amount.
content.rate.lockSideThe requested value for the 'lockside'.
content.rate.rateTypeThe currency pair used in the rate calculation.
Note: The second currency in the pair is the more major of the two in Corpay's internal ranking.
content.rate.operationThe operation that is used on the amount to get the quote. Possible values = ['Multiply' or 'Divide'].
If the 'settlementCurrency' is higher in the Corpay ranking than the 'paymentCurrency', the operation is 'Multiply'. If the opposite is true, the operation is 'Divide'.
content.quoteIdThe unique ID assigned to the quote.
content.payment.currencyThe three-letter ISO code for the payment currency.
content.payment.amountPayment amount.
content.settlement.currencyThe three-letter ISO code for the settlement currency.
content.settlement.amountAmount of the settlement.
##### IMPLEMENTATION NOTES: Consider the rate to be available for 8 seconds, and 2 for latency and other network effects. Refresh after that period of time, or there will be time out error. * * * ##### SPOT RATE ERRORS
Error CodeDescription
400 Bad Request - Amount exceeds limitThis reflects the per-client threshold on allowed Spot transactions.
400 Bad Request - Unexpected exceptionInputting an invalid currency code will return this error.

response.name: 400 Spot amount is over limit
response.body: {"errors":[{"key":"OverLimit","type":"input","message":"Amount requested is over your Per-trade Entry Limit of CAD 1000000.00. Please contact your administrator."}]}

response.name: 401 Unauthorized/invalid token
response.body: {"message":"Authorization has been denied for this request."}

request.description:
This is the second of two calls that are used to book a live rate as part of a Spot transaction. This call uses the 'quoteId' returned by the `POST` [Spot Rate](https://apidocscrossborder.corpay.com/#6499f440-a427-48df-b33a-825bec24de82) call to book a deal using the quoted rate. **Important:** The quote obtained from `POST` [Spot Rate](https://apidocscrossborder.corpay.com/#6499f440-a427-48df-b33a-825bec24de82) is valid for 10 seconds, after which it expires. If you don't book the deal before the rate expires, the response status will be '400 (Quote expired)', and you will need to generate a new quote. --- ##### IMPLEMENTATION NOTES: Make sure to append the `/book` at the end of the resource. The terms 'deal number' and 'order number' have the same meaning. --- ##### BOOK DEAL ERRORS
Error CodeDescription
200 OK - Previously booked URL
The quoteID has already been booked so it can't be booked again. Returns: "token": "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000"
404 Not Found Invalid URL invoked
The 'Rate Resource' URL is incorrect. Either it has already been booked or it does not exist. This is the format: {{Rate Resource URL}}/book
410 Gone - Call sent after rate expired
The rate generated by the POST Spot Rate request expires after 10 seconds.

response.name: 405 Method not allowed
response.body: {"message":"The requested resource does not support http method 'GET'."}

response.name: 401 Unauthorized/Invalid Token
response.body: {"message":"Authorization has been denied for this request."}

response.name: 405 'Book' not included
response.body: {"message":"The requested resource does not support http method 'POST'."}

request.description:
Once the Spot Transaction has been booked, you can instruct the funds to a beneficiary or to an internal holding balance (this is specified in the 'payment' portion of this payload). The settlement funds (the 'settlement' portion) can come from a bank account or from a holding balance. This call also specifies which settlement account to use for fees. In most cases, the account designated for fees contains the base currency (for example, if you are located in Canada, your fee settlement account will be a CAD account). The total instructed amount does not have to equal the amount exchanged during the Spot Transaction, but it cannot exceed that amount. **Note:** If the deal is subject to the Regulation E remittance transfer rule as required by the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (commonly referred to as Dodd-Frank), and the order includes at least one payment where the remitter classification is 'Individual', the response will include Reg E payment disclosure information. This is required by U.S. law for electronic funds transfers by individuals. --- ##### REQUEST BODY
ParameterDescription
orderId
string (required)
Number of the deal to which the payment and settlement instructions should be applied.
payments.amount
number (required)
Payment amount.
payments.beneficiaryId
string (required)
Identifier of the beneficiary/FXBalance to whom the payment will be sent. Value can be either 'clientIntegrationId' or 'id' (which is returned by GETView Bene).
payments.deliveryMethod

string (required)
Method to use to send the payment = ['W', 'E', 'C'].

  • 'W' = Wire

  • 'E' = EFT

  • 'C' = FXBalance

payments.currency
string (required)
Three-letter ISO code for the payment currency.
payments.purposeOfPayment
string (required)
The purpose of payment Can be found here: GETPurpose of Payment
Allowed input limit: Max 50 characters. Returns 500 error if max input limit exceeded.
payments.paymentReference
string (optional)
Reference to be included with the payment, for example, purchase order number or invoice number.
Allowed input limit: Max 120 characters. Returns 500 error if max input limit exceeded.
payments.remitterId
string (optional)
Identifier of the remitter on whose behalf the payment is being made.
settlements.accountId
string (required)
Settlement account identifier.
settlements.deliveryMethod

string (required)
Method to use to settle the deal = ['W', 'E', 'C'].

  • 'W' = Wire

  • 'E' = EFT

  • 'C' = FXBalance

settlements.currency
string (required)
Three-letter ISO code for the settlement account currency.
settlements.purpose
string (required)
The reason for the settlement = ['All', 'Allocation', 'Fee', 'Spot', 'SpotTrade', 'Drawdown'].
##### RESPONSE BODY
ParameterDescription
content.ordNum
Unique global identifier of the order.
content.valueDate
Order value date.
content.fees
Fee amount.
content.payments.paymentInstructionId
Internal Identifier of the Payment Instruction. Different from the Deal and/or Order Numbers.
content.payments.availableDate
The date when the payment will be received by the beneficiary.
content.payments.orderId
An internal identifier for the order. Different from the global 'ordNum'.
content.payments.amount
The amount paid to the beneficiary.
content.payments.currency
The currency in which the beneficiary will receive the payment.
content.payments.approvalStatus

An internal indicator of the payment status. Only relevant if there is an approval model set up with the account. Possible values:

  • 'A' - Approved

  • 'P' - Pending

  • 'D' - Declined

content.payments.feeAmount
The amount of the fee levied on the payment.
content.payments.feeCurrency
Currency of the fee.
content.payments.estimateCostAmount
The cost of the settlement currency.
content.payments.estimateCostCurrency
The currency of the settlement part of the transaction.
content.payments.beneId
The beneficiary's 'id' found in the GETView Beneendpoint.
content.payments.reference
Payment References carried on from the 'paymentReference' field.
content.payments.method

Method to use to send the payment. Possible values returned = ['W', 'E', 'C'].

  • 'W' = Wire

  • 'E' = EFT

  • 'C' = FXBalance

content.payments.payeeName
The name of the beneficiary/account to whom the payment will be sent.
content.payments.accountType

The out-going template type. Possible values returned:

  • 'bene' = Beneficiary

  • 'linkBalance' = FXBalance

content.payments.payeeAccount
The account number of the payee account.
content.payments.clientIntegrationId
The unique identifier assigned to the beneficiary.
content.payments.trackerId
The unique tracker identifier assigned to a payment transaction.
content.settlements.accountId
Settlement account identifier.
content.settlements.method

Method to use to settle the deal. Possible values returned = ['W', 'E', 'C'].

  • 'W' = Wire

  • 'E' = EFT

  • 'C' = FXBalance

content.settlements.methodDescription

The description for 'settlements.method'. Possible values returned = ['Wire', 'CLIAB', 'iACH'].

  • 'CLIAB' = FXBalance

  • 'iACH' = EFT

content.settlements.accountDetails
Displays the name on the account for the incoming template.
content.settlements.paymentIdent
An internal identifier of the payment account. Not to be confused with the payment account identifier ('accountId') which is used when instructing the deal.
content.settlements.settlementId
An internal identifier of the settlement account. Not to be confused with the settlement account identifier ('accountId') which is used when instructing the deal.
content.settlements.isFee
Indicates whether the settlement account listed will also be used to settle the fee.
content.settlements.amount
The settled amount of the transaction.
content.settlements.currency
Currency of the Settlement part of the transaction.
content.settlements.accountType
The template type used for settlement. Possible values returned = ['settlement'].
content.orderDetail.ordNum
The order number is the unique global identifier of the order.
content.orderDetail.buy
ISO 3 currency code of the buy-side currency.
content.orderDetail.buyAmount
Amount of the buy-side currency.
content.orderDetail.sell
ISO 3 currency code of the sell-side currency.
content.orderDetail.sellAmount
Amount of the sell-side currency.
content.orderDetail.exchange
The quoted amount’s all-in rate as part of the spot transaction.
content.orderDetail.ourAction
Value is always set to 'Sell'. Denotes the action that Corpay undertakes to exchange the two currencies.
content.orderDetail.entryDate
Timestamp of the deal when the order was entered.
content.orderDetail.token
The session token.
content.regEDisclosure.regulatoryAgencyName
Financial Institution responsible for investigating and resolving claims.
content.regEDisclosure.transferFees
Transfer fee charged.

Transfer fee currency.

##### INSTRUCT DEAL ERRORS
Error CodeDescription
400 Bad Request - Improper settlement account / wrong 'deliveryMethod'
Either the Client does not have the permission set to settle with this account type, or the account identifier invoked is incorrect.
400 Bad Request - Improper bene / wrong 'deliveryMethod'

Could be one of the following:

  • The identifier of the beneficiary invoked is incorrect (the 'clientIntegrationId' or 'id').

  • The bene does not exist (therefore the 'id' or 'clientIntegrationId' that you are using is invalid).

400 Bad Request - Invalid / already-instructed Order Number
The order number has already been instructed or it doesn't belong to your account.
400 Bad Request - Amount exceeds Spot balance
The order does not contain the funds available to pay the beneficiary. A top-up is not possible.

request.description:
Allows you to view the following information for a specific order: * 'regEDisclosure' - RegE Disclosure information (if applicable) * 'payments' - beneficiary details * 'settlements' - settlement details * 'orderDetails' - rates, amounts, trade details, etc. **Note:** If the order is subject to the Regulation E remittance transfer rule as required by the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (commonly referred to as Dodd-Frank), and the order includes at least one payment where the remitter classification is 'Individual', the response will include Reg E payment disclosure information. This is required by U.S. law for electronic funds transfers by individuals. * * * ##### RESPONSE BODY
ParameterDescription
content.regEDisclosure.regulatoryAgencyNameFinancial Institution responsible for investigating and resolving claims.

content.payments.paymentInstructionIdInternal Identifier of the Payment Instruction. Different from the Deal and/or Order Numbers.

An internal indicator of the payment status. Only relevant if there is an approval model set up with the account. Possible values:

request.description:
When you run the Spot Rate call `POST` [Spot Rate](https://apidocscrossborder.corpay.com/#6499f440-a427-48df-b33a-825bec24de82), a resource is created that contains the conversion and quote information. This endpoint returns the resource details. * * * ##### RESPONSE BODY
ParameterDescription
content.idThe quote's resource identifier.
content.expiryThe number of seconds before the quote expires.
content.isOverLimitIndicates whether the amount on the booked deal exceeds the trade limit allowed on the account.
content.quoteTimestampTimestamp when the quote was called.
content.expiryTimestampTimestamp when the quote expires ('quoteTimeStamp' + 'expiry').
content.payment.currencyCurrency of the payment.
content.payment.amountAmount of the payment.
content.settlement.currencyCurrency of the settlement.
content.settlement.amountAmount of the settlement.
content.rate.valueThe result of the 'lockside' amount and the operation 'type' (as either a multiple or a quotient).
content.rate.lockSideThe base currency of the pair; the opposite of the quoted currency. The value can be 'payment' or 'settlement'.
content.rate.rateTypeThe currency pair used in the rate calculation.
Note: The second currency in the pair is the more major of the two in Corpay's internal ranking.
content.expiryRemainingThe number of seconds left between booking the rate and the rate expiry ('Book' - 'expiryTimestamp')
content.requestDurationThe duration of the call between the 'quoteTimestamp' and 'Booking'
content.rateDifferentialThe differential in interest rates between the two currencies.

item.description:
This set of endpoints deals with the _exchange_ of a currency pair and the _transmission_ of that exchanged currency to a beneficiary or a holding balance. The first three endpoints are the key elements of the Spot Workflow:
  1. Spot Rate
  2. Book Deal
  3. Instruct Deal
The other three endpoints are used to fetch rate and quote information: * Lookup Orders * Rate Resource * Quotes

item.name: Rate Orders

request.description:
Creates a new Rate Order. You can create Spot Rate Orders and Forward Rate Orders. Forward Rate Orders can be either Closed Forwards or Open Forwards. --- ##### REQUEST BODY
ParameterDescription
buyCurrencystring (required)
The three-letter ISO code for the buy currency.
sellCurrencystring (required)
The three-letter ISO code for the sell currency.
amountnumber (required)
The amount of the buy currency.
ratestring (required)
The rate at which you want the Rate Order to be filled.
expiryDatestring (required)
The date when the Rate Order expires.
lockSidestring (required)
Indicates which currency to lock when the rate calculation is performed = ['Payment' or 'Settlement'].
limitOrderTypestring (required)
The type of Rate Order = ['Spot' or 'Forward'].
openDateFromstring (required if 'limitOrderType' = 'Forward' and 'forwardType' = 'O')
The first date that you can draw down against the forward, formatted as yyyy-mm-dd.
maturityDatestring (required if 'limitOrderType' = Forward)
The last date the funds can be used, formatted as yyyy-mm-dd.
forwardType

string (required if 'limitOrderType' = 'Forward')
The type of Forward Rate Order = ['O' or 'C'].

  • 'O' - Open

  • 'C' - Closed

request.description:
Retrieves complete information for all of your Rate Orders.
----
##### RESPONSE BODY
Parameter Description
content.rows.id The Rate Order identifier.
content.rows.productType The type of Rate Order. Possible values = ['Spot' or 'Forward']
content.rows.buy The three-letter ISO code for the buy currency.
content.rows.sell The three-letter ISO code for the sell currency.
content.rows.buyAmount The amount of the buy currency.
content.rows.sellAmount The amount of the sellcurrency.
content.rows.status The status of the Rate Order. Possible values = ['F', 'P', 'E', 'X'].
  • 'F' - Filled
  • 'P' - Pending
  • 'E' - Expired
  • 'X' - Deleted
content.rows.entryDate The date that the order was created, formatted as yyyy-mm-dd.
content.rows.filledDate The date the order was filled, formatted as yyyy-mm-dd.
If the order is pending, returns null.
content.rows.targetRate The rate at which the Rate Order can be filled.
content.rows.expiryDate The date when the Rate Order expires.
This endpoint permanently deletes the specified Rate Order. You cannot delete more than one Rate Order at the same time.

item.description:
A Rate Order is an order to buy or sell currency at a specific rate or better. If the target rate becomes available before the order's expiry date, the system will automatically book the deal. You can create Rate Orders for spot trades and for forward trades.

Important: A Rate Order is not guaranteed to fill.

item.name: Forwards and Drawdowns
Forwards

request.description:
This endpoint and the following two calls (ordered \[1\] through \[3\]) must be submitted in quick succession within the allotted time (default, but adjustable, 10 second window). This call is the Request for Forward Contract information. If all information is provided correctly, the subsequent call - `GET` [Retrieve Forward Quote](https://apidocscrossborder.corpay.com/#3c7cfef4-bbc4-4163-b1c4-c1b88ad21bd1) – will return the quote details. * * * ##### REQUEST BODY
ParameterDescription
amountnumber (required)
The amount of currency locked into the forward agreement.
buyCurrencystring (required)
Three-letter ISO code for the currency being bought.
forwardTypestring (required)
Contract type is determined according to business needs. Possible values = ['C', closed contract; 'O', open contract].
lockSidestring (required)
Indicates which currency should be locked when the rate calculation is performed = ['payment', 'settlement'].
maturityDatestring (required)
The date of forward maturity, formatted as yyyy-mm-dd.
OpenDateFromstring (required if 'forwardType': 'O')
Applies only to Open Forwards.
sellCurrencystring (required)
Three-letter ISO code for the settlement-side currency.
##### RESPONSE BODY
ParameterDescription
content.rate.valueThe result of applying the 'operation' type to the 'lockside' amount.
content.rate.lockSideThe requested value for the 'lockside'.
content.rate.rateTypeThe currency pair used in the rate calculation.
Note: The second currency in the pair is the more major of the two in Corpay's internal ranking.
content.rate.operationThe operation that is used on the amount to get the quote. Possible values = ['Multiply' or 'Divide'].
If the 'settlementCurrency' is higher in the Corpay ranking than the 'paymentCurrency', the operation is 'Multiply'. If the opposite is true, the operation is 'Divide'.
content.quoteIdThe unique ID assigned to the quote.
content.payment.currencyThe three-letter ISO code for the payment currency.
content.payment.amountPayment amount.
content.settlement.currencyThe three-letter ISO code for the settlement currency.
content.settlement.amountAmount of the settlement.
##### REQUEST FORWARD QUOTE ERRORS
Error CodeDescription
400 Bad Request - Inputted Buy Currency is not available"buyCurrency" is not available as a Corpay-offered currency.

exec: tests["Failed to book, quote expired"] = responseCode.code !== 410;

request.description:
This is the final of three endpoints that books the rate and amount in question.  
The URL for this endpoint is found in the Response Body of the previous endpoint as a HATEOAS link.  
If you don't book the deal before the rate expires, the response status will be '400 (Quote expired)', and you will need to generate a new quote. The Response – if successful – includes the 'orderNumber'.

This is the final step of the forward process and it completes the order. The URL for this endpoint is found in the Response Body of the previous endpoint as a HATEOAS link.
----
##### REQUEST BODY
Parameter Description
settlementAccount string (required)
The settlement account.
forwardReference string (optional)
Any comments or reference information related to the forward.

response.name: 400 incorrect settlement account

request.description:
This call returns details about the forward quote requested in the previous call `POST` [Request Forward Quote](https://apidocscrossborder.corpay.com/#224cf8ab-1219-4569-97ef-80dd4c49face). The URL for this endpoint is found in the Response Body of the previous endpoint as a HATEOAS link. If the content in the Response is empty and the status code is '410 Gone', this means that the quote has expired. * * * ##### RESPONSE BODY
ParameterDescription
content.idThe quote’s unique resource identifier.
content.expiryThe allotted window of time, expressed in seconds.
content.isOverLimitIndicates whether the amount exceeds the trade limit allowed on the account.
content.quoteTimeStampTimestamp when the quote was called.
content.expiryTimeStampTimestamp when the quote expires ('quoteTimeStamp' + 'expiry').
content.payment.currencyCurrency of the payment.
content.payment.amountAmount of the payment.
content.settlement.currencyCurrency of the settlement.
content.settlement.amountAmount of the settlement.
content.rate.valueThe result of taking the amount specified on the 'lockside' field and performing the operation indicated on the 'type' field (as either a multiple or a quotient).
content.rate.locksideThe base currency of the pair, opposite of the quoted currency. Either 'Payment' or 'Settlement'.
content.rate.typeAddresses the 'operation' that is performed on the base currency to obtain the quoted rate. Allowed values are ‘Multiply’ or ‘Divide’.
content.expiryRemainingThe number of seconds left before the rate expires.
content.requestDurationThe duration of the call between the 'quoteTimestamp' and 'Booking'.

This call is used after you book the rate and amount in the forward agreement. The URL for this endpoint is found in the Response Body of the previous endpoint (`POST` [\[3\] Book Forward Quote](https://apidocscrossborder.corpay.com/#1a387cd6-f419-4c4f-9383-8e344e639a17)) as a HATEOAS link. The URL now contains the 'forwardID', which is different from the 'orderNumber' (which is handed in the Response Body). * * * ##### RESPONSE BODY
ParameterDescription
content.ordNumThe order number of the forward.
content.contractType.idIndicates the type of Forward Contract. Possible values = ['O', 'C'].

response.name: 200 Forward Guidelines

item.description:
Forward Contracts are an effective way to hedge against foreign exchange fluctuations by locking in the current FX rate, and then settling that rate and amount at a future date. 
There are two types of forward agreements: Closed Forwards and Open Forwards.
* A Closed Forward lets you lock in the current exchange rate, and receive foreign currency funds on a specified future date (also known as the _maturity date_). This type of contract requires you to complete the transaction on the date it expires (the Maturity Date) at the agreed rate of exchange. A Closed Forward is settled in its entirety on the maturity date.
* With an Open Forward, you also lock in the current exchange rate for a future date value and settlement, but unlike a Closed Forward, you can draw down the funds at any time within the specified period. You do not need to wait until the maturity date. All the drawdowns are processed at the agreed upon rate. The trade can be settled either in full or in part as long as the full amount has been paid by the maturity date.  



The following identifiers are created for each completed forward:
* The **ordNum** is the _alpha-numeric_ transaction identifier. It is same as the _deal number_ except that it is prefixed with 'OFD' (i.e. ‘OFD40123456’).
* The **forwardId/paymentInstructionId** is the numeric forward identifier (i.e. ‘1386511’).
* The **quoteId** is the identifier of the forward quote rate resource (i.e. 'cc2999ba7eb84e19a158a8bf0f21296e')

item.name: Drawdowns

request.description:
This endpoint returns information about all your forwards. It displays forwards that are available now, those that will be available at a future date, and those that are incomplete. You can draw down funds from any of the forwards that have the status 'Available'. --- ##### RESPONSE BODY
ParameterDescription
content.data.rows.forwardIdAn ID assigned to the forward when it was booked.
content.data.rows.currencyThe currency that you purchased.
content.data.rows.dealThe deal number of the completed forward.
Note: Incomplete forwards do not have a deal number.
content.data.rows.ordNumThe system assigned deal number.
content.data.rows.statusDesc

Indicates whether the forward can be drawn down.

  • Available = The funds are available and you can use the funds to create payments.

  • Available in x days = The funds will be available in the specified number of days.

  • Incomplete = The forward is not complete. Usually this means that all of the required information has not been submitted.

content.data.rows.status

The status indicates whether the forward can be drawn down.

  • 1 = Incomplete.

  • 2 = Available.

  • 3 = Available at a future date.

content.data.rows.dealDateThe date you booked the forward.
content.data.rows.openFromThe first date that you can start drawing down against the booked forward.
content.data.rows.maturityDateFor open forwards, this is the last date when you draw down funds. For closed forwards, this is the date when the funds become available for use.
content.data.rows.availableBalanceThis is the amount of the forward that is available to use. If you have already drawn down funds against this forward, this is the remaining balance.
content.data.rows.rateThe rate of exchange at which the forward was booked.
content.data.rows.costCurrencyThe currency with which the forward was settled.
content.data.rows.costAmountThe amount that was required to settle the forward.
content.data.rows.createdByThe name of the person who created the forward.
content.data.rows.amountThe amount of the forward.
content.data.rows.linksReturned only for Incomplete forwards.

item.description: The drawdown workflow withdraws or instructs a specified amount from the available balance of the forward contract. This can happen on the 'Maturity' date, or, in the case of an Open forward, this can happen on or after the open date.
Forward trades allow you to lock in to a specific exchange rate. You can then draw down against the forward to make payments at a future date.

item.name: Cancel Order

request.description:
To use this call, you need to have an 'orderNumber', that is, you need to have booked a quote. The endpoint uses the order number in the URL to identify the currencies and amounts of the order you want to cancel. Unlike `POST` [Spot Rate](https://apidocscrossborder.corpay.com/#6499f440-a427-48df-b33a-825bec24de82), there is no quote resource created by calling this endpoint. This is because the rate of the initial transaction is used. The response contains the link to the `POST` [Book Cancellation](https://apidocscrossborder.corpay.com/#8eab595d-28b4-4d1e-ad3c-9adb2fe5f9c0). **Note:** If the client is subject to the Regulation E remittance transfer rule as required by the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (commonly referred to as Dodd-Frank), the entire order can be cancelled without any charges if the following conditions are met: - There is at least one payment instruction in the deal with a remitter whose classification is 'Individual'. - The payment is cancelled within 30 minutes of it being booked or instructed. --- ##### RESPONSE BODY
ParameterDescription
content.trades.originalTrade.buyAmountAmount of the buy-side currency.
content.trades.originalTrade.buyCurrencyISO currency code of the buy-side currency.
content.trades.originalTrade.costAmountAmount of the sell-side currency.
content.trades.originalTrade.costCurrencyISO currency code of the sell-side currency.
content.trades.charge.amountThe amount that is charged for carrying out the cancellation transaction (if applicable).
content.trades.charge.currencyThe currency of the charge levied on the cancellation. The currency is the settlement currency.
Amount of the sell-side currency.
content.trades.cancelRate.valueThe value of the cancellation rate.
content.trades.cancelRate.rateTypeThe currency pair used in the rate calculation.
Note: The second currency in the pair is the more major of the two in Corpay's internal ranking.

The link for Book Cancellation is provided in the response body of the `POST` [Request Cancellation](https://apidocscrossborder.corpay.com/#d3265839-363d-4606-9f87-f316089522ad). If this endpoint is successful, an order number is granted.

item.description:
The cancellation workflow creates a ‘mirror-reverse’ transaction for the deal you are cancelling. For example, the cancellation of a USD/CAD spot deal is a CAD/USD transaction. When you provide the order number of the original Spot, the rest of the information is invoked (such as amounts and currencies).

Orders created via Spot and Forward workflows can be cancelled.

Just as the `POST` [Spot Rate](https://apidocscrossborder.corpay.com/#6499f440-a427-48df-b33a-825bec24de82) and `POST` [Book Deal](https://apidocscrossborder.corpay.com/#3bc872ce-26ad-45cb-8b70-b0a1e7e58434) workflow has a timer, `Request Cancellation` and `Book Cancellation` also has an allotted window of time (the default is 10 seconds).

**Note:** There is no timer between when you book a deal and when you can cancel it, however, we recommend that you request the cancellation within a reasonable time, taking into account currency fluctuations.

item.description:
Similar to how the beneficiary template creates a record for the beneficiary and bank account to be paid, the settlement account template is for the bank account that is issuing the payment. The Settlement Account template is also known as the ‘Incoming Funds Template’. Once complete, these accounts can be used to settle transactions and payments.  
Accounts created through this workflow are non-Corpay bank accounts. FXBalance Accounts or Corpay holding account templates are not created in this same way.

item.name: Remitter

request.description:
Remitters are used when a payment is initiated by a third party. This endpoint allows you to create the remitters that can then be attached to payments. Similar to the `POST` [Create/Edit Bene](https://apidocscrossborder.corpay.com/#36685106-4a23-48e8-b518-d98d869dbc85) call, the PUT method is used for better error handling due to idempotency of PUT requests. The URL query string contains the Remitter ID, which must be unique. You can either use [GUID](https://guidgenerator.com/) as it has very low chance of collision, your own hash, or some deterministic prefix in order to make sure it is unique. **Note:** The only characters allowed in the 'uniqueRemitterId' are alphanumeric (a-zA-Z0-9), dash (-), and underscore (_). * * * ##### REQUEST BODY

item.description:
The Mass Payment workflow is a two-step payment-aggregation workflow designed to make payments to multiple beneficiaries at the same time, using a single call. 

The only limitation is the currency-specific account limit of any currency being used for settlement (as outlined in the onboarding agreement).

request.description:
The confirmation endpoint displays a channel-specific payment confirmation message. To receive a successful response, the payment must be _**successfully instructed**_ (status: `200` on `POST` [Instruct Deal](https://apidocscrossborder.corpay.com/#f78752cf-6adf-4427-85a4-69dbc1288bc1)). Rather than `ordNum`, this endpoint uses the `paymentInstructionId` in the URL. You can get the `paymentInstructionId` by using `GET` [Lookup Orders](https://apidocscrossborder.corpay.com/#a3fc0756-d92c-48a9-9cc2-22ae872468a1). **Note:** Messages are provided in full only if the payment has exited the Corpay bank account and is en route to the beneficiary's bank account. Therefore, if the number of returned messages is 0, even though the payment has been booked, it just means the funds haven't left the Corpay bank account. --- ##### RESPONSE BODY
ParameterDescription
content.paymentInstructionThe 'paymentInstructionId' used in the URL.
content.messages.details.responseThe contents of the MT103 message. For an explanation of the fields that may be in the message, see the SWIFT MESSAGE FIELDS table below.
content.messages.details.responseDateThe response date.
content.messages.details.responseReferenceThe SWIFT confirmation ID from the channel.
content.messages.channelThe channel used for the payment = {'SWIFT'}.
content.messages.statusThis field is currently not in use.
##### SWIFT MESSAGE FIELDS
Field NumberField NameDescription
:20Transaction reference numberMessage number assigned by the sender.
:23BBank operation codeType of operation.
:32AValue date, Currency, Interbank settled amountDate format is YYMMDD. Currency is three-letter ISO code.
:33BCurrency, Original ordered amountThree-letter ISO currency code and amount of instruction.
:50A, F, or KOrdering customer (payer) or address of the remitterCustomer ordering the transaction.
:52A or DOrdering institutionPayer's bank.
:53A, B, or DSender's correspondent (bank)Account or branch of sender.
:54A, B, or DReceiver's correspondentBranch or FI where funds are available to receiver.
:56A, C, or DIntermediary bankFI through which transaction must pass.
:59 or 59ABeneficiary customerRecipient of the funds.
:57A, B, C, or DAccount with institutionBeneficiary's account.
:70Remittance informationInformation about the transaction.
:71ADetails of charges.Specifies which party is responsible for fees - OUR, SHA, or BEN.
:72Sender to receiver informationAdditional information for the receiver.
:77BRegulatory reportingRegulatory information required by the sender or receiver country.

request.description:
This endpoint retrieves the tracker identifier of a specific payment by passing its `paymentInstructionId`. You can get the `paymentInstructionId` by using `POST` [Instruct Deal](https://apidocscrossborder.corpay.com/#f78752cf-6adf-4427-85a4-69dbc1288bc1) or `GET` [Lookup Orders](https://apidocscrossborder.corpay.com/#a3fc0756-d92c-48a9-9cc2-22ae872468a1) . ##### RESPONSE BODY
ParameterDescription
content.trackerIdThe unique tracker identifier assigned to a payment transaction.
content.clientNameThe client name
content.sortedNetworkReferencesThe reference assigned by SWIFT network when sending the payment
content.events.uniqueIdThe unique Id assigned to identify the payment event
content.events.typeThe information/status of the payment event at the source
content.events.sourceIdentifies the payment event source
content.events.processedTimestampDate and time at which the payment event was processed at source
content.events.emittedTimestampDate and time at which the payment event was received at source
content.events.fields.clientCodeThe client code
content.events.fields.transIdThe unique transaction identifier for the payment event
content.events.fields.itemKey
content.events.fields.methodThe method used to send the payment
WIRE
EFT
FXBalance
content.events.fields.userKey
content.events.fields.createdTimeDate and time at which the payment event was created at source

request.description:
**Note**: If authenticating via the client-level access_code run this API request `/api/{clientCode}/0/payment-tracking/{trackerId}` Trace the detailed information of a payment transaction by passing its `trackerId` . You can get the `trackerId` by using `POST` [Instruct Deal](https://apidocscrossborder.corpay.com/#f78752cf-6adf-4427-85a4-69dbc1288bc1) or `GET` [Lookup Orders](https://apidocscrossborder.corpay.com/#a3fc0756-d92c-48a9-9cc2-22ae872468a1) or `GET` [Payment Tracking Lookup](https://apidocscrossborder.corpay.com/#06712619-fa45-4243-b99b-490f3982e60f). --- ##### RESPONSE BODY
ParameterDescription
content.trackerId
The unique tracker identifier assigned to a payment transaction.
content.clientCode
The client code.
content.clientName
The client name.
content.uetr
The unique end to end transaction reference of a payment assigned by SWIFT.
content.sortIndexes
Sorts the SWIFT events to help identify the event process order.
content.events.uniqueId
The unique Id assigned to identify the payment event.
content.events.type
The information/status of the payment event at the source. See CORPAY EVENT TYPE table for more details.
content.events.source
Identifies the payment event source.
content.events.processedTimestamp
Date and time at which the payment event was processed by Corpay.
content.events.emittedTimestamp
Date and time at which the payment event was received/updated at source (same as content.events.fields.last_update_time).
content.events.fields.clientCode
The client code.
content.events.fields.uetr
The unique end-to-end transaction reference of a payment assigned by SWIFT.
content.events.fields.createdTime
Date and time at which the payment event was created at source.
content.events.fields.network_reference
Specifies the reference assigned by SWIFT network when sending the payment.
content.events.fields.message_name_identification
The SWIFT message name identifier. See SWIFT MESSAGE NAME IDENTIFICATION table for more details.
content.events.fields.business_service
The business service agreed between the sender and receiver under which rules this Business Message is exchanged. See SWIFT BUSINESS SERVICE table for more details.
content.events.fields.tracker_event_type
Specifies the type of payment event. See SWIFT TRACKER EVENT TYPE table for more details.
content.events.fields.valid
Indicates if a payment is valid (TRUE) or not (FALSE).
content.events.fields.instruction_identification
Unique identification, as assigned by an instructing party for an instructed party, to identify the instruction.
content.events.fields.transaction_status
The payment status in process.
content.events.fields.transaction_status_reason
The reason for the status of a payment transaction. See SWIFT TRANSACTION STATUS CODE table for more details.
content.events.fields.return
Indicates if a payment is a return (TRUE) or not (FALSE).
content.events.fields.forwarded_to_agent
Specifies the BIC of the entity to which the entity reporting the status has forwarded the payment transaction.
content.events.fields.settlement_method
Method used to settle the (batch of) payment instructions. See SWIFT SETTLEMENT METHOD table for more details.
content.events.fields.clearing_system
Specification of a pre-agreed offering between clearing agents or the channel through which the payment instruction is processed.
content.events.fields.from
Business Code Identifier (BIC) of the sender party.
content.events.fields.to
Business Code Identifier (BIC) of the receiver party.
content.events.fields.originator
Business Code Identifier (BIC) of the party that issues the status.
content.events.fields.serial_parties.debtor
Financial institution that owes an amount of money to the (final) financial institutional creditor.
content.events.fields.serial_parties.creditor
Financial institution that receives an amount of money from the financial institutional debtor
content.events.fields.serial_parties.creditor_agent
BIC of the financial institution servicing an account for the creditor.
content.events.fields.serial_parties.debtor_agent
BIC of the financial institution servicing an account for the debtor.
content.events.fields.serial_parties.creditor_account.identification
Unambiguous identification of the account of the creditor to which a credit entry will be posted as a result of the payment transaction.
content.events.fields.serial_parties.instructing_reimbursement_agent
Agent through which the instructing agent identified in the "From" field) will reimburse the instructed agent (identified in the "To" field).
content.events.fields.sender_acknowledgement_receipt
Date and time at which the sender was acknowledged receipt of the message.
content.events.fields.received_date
Date and time at which the message was acknowledged by the receiver.
content.events.fields.instructed_amount.currency
3-character ISO currency code for money to be moved between the debtor (ordering customer) and creditor, as ordered by the initiating party.
content.events.fields.instructed_amount.amount
The amount of money to be moved between the debtor (ordering customer) and creditor, before deduction of charges, as ordered by the initiating party.
content.events.fields.interbank_settlement_amount.currency
3-character ISO currency code for money moved between the instructing agent and the instructed agent.
content.events.fields.interbank_settlement_amount.amount
The amount of money moved between the instructing agent and the instructed agent.
content.events.fields.interbank_settlement_date
Specifies the date on which the amount of money ceases to be available to the agent that owes it and when the amount of money becomes available to the agent to which it is due.
content.events.fields.charge_bearer
Specifies which party/parties will bear the charges associated with the processing of the payment transaction. See SWIFT CHARGE BEARER table for more details.
content.events.fields.charge_amount.currency
3-character ISO currency code for charge amount money.
content.events.fields.charge_amount.amount
See CHARGE AMOUNT CALCULATIONS for a payment event for more details.
content.events.fields.funds_available
Specifies the date and time at which the funds are available.
content.events.fields.confirmed_amount.currency
3-character ISO currency code confirmed by the Originator.
content.events.fields.confirmed_amount.amount
Specifies the amount confirmed by the Originator. Depending on the transaction status, this amount can be the credited amount, pending amount, rejected amount, or transferred amount.
content.events.fields.update_payment
Contains the network reference of the payment for which the status confirmation was applicable.
content.events.fields.last_update_time
The last date and time at which the status of this transaction was updated (same as content.events.emittedTimestamp).
**Note**: Payment Tracking does not currently support exotic currencies. Please contact your account representative for more information. **CHARGE AMOUNT AT EACH CORRESPONDENT BANK IS CALCULATED AS:** **A. First Event** charge_amount = instructed_amount - interbank_settlement_amount **B. Corresponding Events** charge_amount = interbank_settlement_amount/confirmed_amount (previous event) - interbank_settlement_amount/confirmed_amount (current event) **NOTE**: interbank_settlement_amount and confirmed_amount are the amounts forwarded to the next correspondent bank or credited to the beneficiary. ##### CORPAY EVENT TYPE
Field NameDescription
PaymentAccepted
Payment accepted by Corpay
PaymentCanceled
Payment canceled by Corpay
UETRCreated
Payment sent to SWIFT
PaymentProcessed
Payment acknowledged by SWIFT
PaymentTrackingInfoReceived
GPI Event
PaymentProcessedNonSwift
Payment acknowledged by non-SWIFT rail
##### SWIFT SETTLEMENT METHOD
Field NameNameDescription
CLRG
ClearingSystem
Settlement is done through a payment clearing system.
COVE
CoverMethod
Settlement is done through a cover payment.
INDA
InstructedAgent
Settlement is done by the agent
instructed to execute a payment
instruction.
INGA
InstructingAgent
Settlement is done by the agent
instructing and forwarding the payment to the next party in the payment chain.
##### SWIFT TRACKER EVENT TYPE
Field NameNameDescription
COPT
CoverPayment
Indicates a cover payment.
COSU
StatusUpdateCoverPayment
Indicates a cover payment status
update.
CTCA
CreditTransferPaymentCancellationRequest
Indicates a cancellation request related to a credit transfer payment.
CTCR
CreditTransferPaymentCancellationResponse
Indicates a cancellation response related to a credit transfer payment.
CTPT
CustomerCreditTransferPayment
Indicates a customer credit transfer
payment.
CTSU
StatusUpdateCustomerCreditTransferPayment
Indicates a customer credit transfer payment status update.
CTTS
CreditTransferPaymentCancellationRequest-TrackingStatus
Indicates the tracking status of a
cancellation request related to a credit transfer payment.
FTPT
FinancialInstitutionCreditTransferPayment
Indicates a Financial Institution Credit
Transfer Payment.
FTSU
StatusUpdateFinancialInstitutionCredit-TransferPayment
Indicates a Financial Institution Credit Transfer Payment status update.
##### SWIFT BUSINESS SERVICE
Field NameNameDescription
001
gpiCustomerCreditTransferService
Indicates the gpi Customer Credit Transfer (CCT) service.
002
gpiStopAndRecallService
Indicates the gpi Stop and Recall (SRP) service.
004
gpiFinancialInstitutionCreditTransfer-InstantService
Indicates the gpi Financial Institution Credit Transfer service (FIT).
005
gpiCustomerCreditTransferInstantService
Indicates the gpi Customer Credit Transfer Instant service (CCT Instant).
009
gpiCustomerCreditTransferSimpleService
Indicates the gpi Customer Credit Transfer Simple Service.
##### SWIFT TRANSACTION STATUS CODE
Field NameNameDescription
ACCC
AcceptedCreditSettlementCompleted
Settlement on the creditor's account has been completed.
ACSP
AcceptedSettlementInProcess
All preceding checks such as technical validation and customer profile were
successful and therefore the payment initiation has been accepted for execution.
RJCT
Rejected
Payment initiation or individual
transaction included in the payment initiation has been rejected.
##### SWIFT CHARGE BEARER
Field NameNameDescription
CRED
BorneByCreditor
All transaction charges are to be borne by the creditor.
DEBT
BorneByDebtor
All transaction charges are to be borne by the debtor.
SHAR
Shared
In a credit transfer context, means that transaction charges on the sender side are to be borne by the debtor,
transaction charges on the receiver side are to be borne by the creditor. In a direct debit context, means that
transaction charges on the sender side are to be borne by the creditor, transaction charges on the receiver side are to be borne by the debtor.
##### SWIFT TRANSACTION STATUS REASON | Field Name | Name | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | AC01 | IncorrectAccountNumber | Account number is invalid or missing | | AC04 | ClosedAccountNumber | Account number specified has been closed on the bank of account's books. | | AC06 | BlockedAccount | Account specified is blocked, prohibiting posting of transactions against it. | | AM06 | AmountTooLow | Below limit. | | BE01 | InconsistentWithEndCustomer | Identification of end customer is not consistent with associated account number. (formerly CreditorConsistency). | | CUST | RequestedByCustomer | At request of creditor. | | DUPL | Duplication | Payment is a duplicate of another payment. | | FF07 | InvalidPurpose | Purpose is missing or invalid. | | FOCR | FollowingCancellationRequest | Return following a cancellation request. | | G000 | PaymentTransferredAndSLAMaintained | The Status Originator transferred the Credit Transfer to the next Agent or to a Market Infrastructure maintaining the
transaction's service obligations. | | G001 | PaymentTransferredAndSLANoLongerMaintained | The Status Originator transferred the Credit Transfer to the next Agent or to a Market Infrastructure where the
transaction's service obligations may no longer be guaranteed. | | G002 | CreditDebitNotConfirmed | The transaction processing cannot be completed the same day. | | G003 | CreditPendingDocuments | In an FI to FI Customer Credit Transfer: Credit to creditor's account is pending receipt of required documents. The
Status Originator has requested creditor to provide additional documentation. | | G004 | CreditPendingFunds | Credit to the creditor's account is pending as status Originator is waiting for funds provided via a cover. | | G007 | MIPaymentTransferred | The payment of the (gpi) sending MI agent was transferred to the receiving MI
agent. | | G008 | MIPaymentTransferredAndReceived | The payment of the (gpi) sending MI agent was transferred to and received by
the receiving MI agent. | | MS03 | NotSpecifiedReasonAgentGenerated | Reason has not been specified by agent. | | NOAS | NoAnswerFromCustomer | Failed to contact beneficiary | | RC01 | BankIdentifierIncorrect | Bank identifier code specified in the message has an incorrect format (formerly
IncorrectFormatForRoutingCode) | | RR03 | MissingCreditorNameOrAddress | Specification of the creditor's name and/ or address needed for regulatory requirements is insufficient or missing. | | RR05 | RegulatoryInformationInvalid | Regulatory or Central Bank Reporting information missing, incomplete or invalid. | | RC08 | InvalidClearingSystemMemberIdentifier | Routing code not valid for local clearing. | **SWIFT MESSAGE NAME IDENTIFICATION** | **Message Type** | **Description** | **Purpose** | | --- | --- | --- | | MT 101 | Request for Transfer | Requests to debit a customer's account held at the receiver or at another institution. | | MT 102 | Multiple Customer Credit Transfer | Conveys multiple payment instructions between financial institutions. | | MT 102 +(STP) | Multiple Customer Credit Transfer (STP) | Conveys multiple payment instructions between financial institutions (Straight-Through Processing). | | MT 103 | Single Customer Credit Transfer | Instructs a funds transfer. | | MT 103+(REMIT) | Single Customer Credit Transfer (REMIT) | Instructs a funds transfer (Straight-Through Processing). | | MT 103+(STP) | Single Customer Credit Transfer (STP) | Instructs a funds transfer (Straight-Through Processing). | | MT 104 | Direct Debit and Request for Debit Transfer Message (STP) | Conveys direct debit instructions and requests for direct debits between financial institutions (Straight-Through Processing). | | MT 105 | EDIFACT Envelope | An envelope which conveys a 2k EDIFACT message. | | MT 106 | EDIFACT Envelope | An envelope which conveys a 2k EDIFACT message. | | MT 107 | General Direct Debit Message | Conveys direct debit instructions between financial institutions. | | MT 110 | Advice of Cheque(s) | Advises or confirms the issuance of a cheque to the drawee bank. | | MT 111 | Request for Stop Payment of a Cheque | Requests the drawee bank to stop payment of a cheque. | | MT 112 | Status of a Request for Stop Payment of a Cheque | Indicates action(s) taken in attempting to stop payment of a cheque. | | MT 121 | Multiple Interbank Funds Transfer (EDIFACT FINPAY Message) | Conveys multiple payment instructions between financial institutions in EDIFACT format. | | MT 190 | Advice of Charges, Interest and Other Adjustments | Advises an account owner of charges, interest, and other adjustments. | | MT 191 | Request for Payment of Charges, Interest and Other Expenses | Requests payment of charges, interest, or other expenses. | | MT 192 | Request for Cancellation | Requests the receiver to consider cancellation of the message identified in the request. | | MT 195 | Queries | Requests information relating to a previous message or amendment to a previous message. | | MT 196 | Answers | Responds to an MT 195 Query or MT 192 Request for Cancellation or other message where no specific message type has been provided for a response. | | MT 198 | Proprietary Message | Contains formats defined and agreed to between users and for those messages not yet live. | | MT 199 | Free Format Message | Contains information for which no other message type has been defined. |
