request.description:
This client onboarding method enables our partners to submit a corporate client onboarding request along with the listed data points below. On successful onboarding a unique client onboarding identifier (`clientOnboardingId)` is returned. A wide range of required data points can be passed via the client onboarding method including corporate client address information, ID information, and key business individual details. --- ##### REQUEST BODY
ParameterDescription
CompanyName
string (required)
Client's complete legal name to be onboarded
DBAOrRegisteredTradeName
string (optional)
DBA/Registered Trade name/ Business name (if applicable)
CompanyStreetAddress
string (required)
Current business address
Note: Do not enter PO Box number.
CompanyCity
string (required)
Current business location - city/town/suburb
CompanyState
string (required if country is US or Canada)
Current business location -state/province.
For a list of valid values run GET /api/regions?Country=US
CompanyPostalCode
string (required)
Current business zip/postal code
CompanyCountryCode
string (required)
Current business country code (2 character ISO code)
For a list of valid values run GET /api/countries
BusinessContactNumber
string (required)
Registered current business phone number
BusinessConfirmationEmail
string (required)
Registered current business email for confirmation
BusinessConfirmationEmail2
string (optional)
Alternative current registered business email for confirmation
IsPubliclyTraded
boolean(optional)
Does the company publicly trade?
TRUE/ FALSE
StockSymbol
string (optional)
Stock Exchange Symbol
FormationIncorporationCountryCode
string (required)
The country code in which the current company is incorporated or legally registered (2 character ISO code)
For a list of valid values run GET /api/countries
FormationIncorporationState
string (required if country is US or Canada)
The state/province in which the current company is incorporated or legally registered
For a list of valid values run GET /api/regions?Country=US
BusinessRegistrationIncorporationNumber
string (required)
Current business Registration/Incorporation Number/ACN/ABN Number/Unique Entity Number (UEN)
TaxIDEINNumber
string (optional, required if country is US, GB, IE, SG)
Tax ID/EIN/VAT/GST Registration number
NatureOfBusiness
string (required)
The type of business (any primary and secondary activities)
For a list of valid values run GET /api/clientonboarding/onboardingpicklists?pickListType=NatureOfBusiness
SeeReference Datafolder for more details.
BusinessTypeId
string (optional)
Type of company to be onboarded.
For a list of valid values run GET /api/clientonboarding/onboardingpicklists?pickListType=BusinessType
SeeReference Datafolder for more details.
WebsiteUrl
string (optional)
Current business website URL
ApplicantTypeId
string (required)
Legal structure of the company.
For a list of valid values run GET /api/clientonboarding/onboardingpicklists?pickListType=ApplicantType
SeeReference Datafolder for more details.
OwnedByOtherCorporateEntity
boolean (optional)
Is the company owned by other corporate entity?TRUE/ FALSE
OwnedByPubliclyTradedCompany
boolean(optional)
Does the company publicly trade?
TRUE/ FALSE
OwnedByPubliclyTradedCompanyStockSymbol
string (optional)
Stock Exchange Symbol of owning entity
PurposeOfTransactionId
string (required)
Purpose of transactions id.
For a list of valid values run GET /api/clientonboarding/onboardingpicklists?pickListType=PurposeOfTransaction
SeeReference Datafolder for more details.
CurrencyNeeded
string (required)
Currencies needed (3 character currency code, comma separated)
For a list of valid values run GET /api/payCurrencies?product=QuickQuote
TradeVolume
string (required)
Approximate per trade volumes.
For a list of valid values run GET /api/clientonboarding/onboardingpicklists?pickListType=TradeVolumeRange
SeeReference Datafolder for more details.
AnnualVolume
string (required)
Approximate Annual Volume.
For a list of valid values run GET /api/clientonboarding/onboardingpicklists?pickListType=AnnualVolumeRange
SeeReference Datafolder for more details.
FundDestinationCountries
string (required)
Countries to which funds transfer are expected to go to (2 character country code, comma separated)
For a list of valid values run GET /api/countries
FundSourceCountries
string (required)
Countries which funds transfer are expected to come from (2 character country code, comma separated)
For a list of valid values run GET /api/countries
CompanyDirectors.FullName
string (required)
Director or senior officer full legal name
CompanyDirectors.JobTitle
string (required)
Director or senior officer job title
CompanyDirectors.Occupation
string (required)
Director or senior officer occupation
AnyIndividualOwn25PercentOrMore
boolean (required)
Does any individual own 25% or more ownership of the company
TRUE/ FALSE
BeneficialOwners.FullName
string (required if any individual owns more than 25%)
Beneficial Owner full legal name
Note: A maximum of 4 beneficial owners can be added in a single request.
BeneficialOwners.Nationality
string (required if any individual owns more than 25%)
Beneficial Owner nationality
BeneficialOwners.SSN
numeric (required if beneficial owner nationality entered above is US and application is for a non- US company)
Beneficial Owner Social security number.
BeneficialOwners.ResidentialAddress
string (required if any individual owns more than 25%)
Beneficial Owner residential address
BeneficialOwners.OwnershipPercentage
string (required if any individual owns more than 25%)
Beneficial ownership percentage
BeneficialOwners.BeneficialOwnerDOB
string (optional, required if country is AU)
Beneficial owner date of birth
ProvideTruthfulInformation
boolean (required)
All statements in this Agreement, and any other information and documentation submitted in support of this Agreement, are true and correct.
TRUE/ FALSE
Note: The value must be true to complete onboarding request.
AgreeToTermsAndConditions
boolean (required)
Client has read, understood and hereby accepts the attached terms and conditions -https://cross-border.corpay.com/tc/
TRUE/ FALSE
Note: The value must be true to complete onboarding request.
ConsentToPrivacyNotice
boolean (required)
Consent to Privacy Notice athttps://payments.corpay.com/compliance

request.description:
**Note**: - After you receive the `clientOnboardingId` in response, we recommend you wait for 60 seconds before you run the request to submit the files. - On uploading files, if you get a 400 Error, please re-try the request. After you submit the client information via the `POST Client Onboarding` request, to complete the onboarding process upload the verification documents for that client (See D**ocuments required for Onboarding** table below). Additional onboarding files requests can be made if further client on-boarding documentation is needed. **Request Parameters** 1. Specify the `clientOnboardingId` in the URL. The unique `clientOnboardingId` is returned in the Client Onboarding response. See `POST Client Onboarding` 2. Files must be uploaded in binary format. 3. A maximum of 10 files can be uploaded in a single request and the total file upload size cannot exceed 5 MB. 4. The allowed file types are **PDF**, **PNG**, and **JPEG** only. 5. The file name must be specified for each document submitted. 6. If any of the upload criteria fails, the entire request will be rejected. **Documents Required for Onboarding** | **Country** | **Document(s) Required** | | --- | --- | | US |

  • No document required.

| | Canada |

  • Proof of Beneficial Owner(s) - E.g. Schedule 50

  • Proof of director(s) - e.g., Oncorp Corporate Profile or Business Registration.

| | GB |

  • Copy of ID Proof for Signatories, Authorized Users, and Beneficial Owners who DO NOT RESIDE in GB.

  • Address Proof for Signatories, Authorized Users, and Beneficial Owners who DO NOT RESIDE in GB.

| | EEA (Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Republic of Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, and Sweden) |

  • Copy of ID Proof for Signatories & Beneficial Owners who DO NOT RESIDE in GB.

  • Address Proof for Signatories and Beneficial Owners who DO NOT RESIDE in GB.

  • For Italy, the following additional document is required in addition to the documents mentioned above - Codice Fiscale (Tax ID) for Signatories, Authorized Users, and Beneficial Owners.

| | Jersey |

  • Certified Copy of ID for Signatories,Authorized Users, and Beneficial Owners.

  • Proof of address for Signatories, Authorized Users, and Beneficial Owners.

| | Australia |

  • Proof of Beneficial Owner(s) - e.g., Illion Report

  • Proof of Director(s) - E.g., Illion Report

  • Copy of ID and Proof of address for Signatories

  • PDS and FSG to the directors (Retail clients)

| | Singapore |

  • Directors/Board Resolution

  • Memorandum and article of association

  • Proof of Beneficial Owner(s) - (e.g. ACRA report)

  • Certified Copy of ID for Directors,Authorized Users, and Beneficial Owners.

  • Proof of address for Director(s),Authorized Users, and Beneficial Owners.

item.description:
**To complete an onboarding request:**

- Onboard a client via the `POST api/clientonboarding request`. On successful submission of data, a unique `clientOnboardingId` will be generated
- Submit the required verification documents for the onboarded client via the `POST api/clientonboarding-files/clientOnboardingId request`. This is a mandatory requirement to complete the client onboarding process.
    

**Note**:

- You cannot create duplicate clients.
- See [Documents Required for Onboarding](https://apidocscrossborder.corpay.com/#c9b83495-8099-46bc-82e1-a7aba3f4f9bd) table to view a list of the verification documents required.

item.description: The onboarding API allows our integrated partners to expedite the on-boarding process of their downstream clients. Partners can submit the onboarding data and the required verification documents via the onboarding endpoints.

item.name: Webhooks
Setup webhooks
item.description:
#### Test your webhook endpoint before enabling it on Production.

1. Identify the events you want to monitor.
2. Create a webhook endpoint as an HTTP endpoint (URL) on your local server.
3. Receive notification and return 2xx response status code.
4. Test that your webhook endpoint is working properly. Call the corresponding API to track the request and verify the notification updates.
    

#### Enable on Production

1. Once verified, deploy your webhook endpoint and make it a publicly accessible HTTPS URL.
    
2. Register your public HTTPS URL with Corpay.

item.name: Subscribe to webhooks
item.description:
Please contact your account representative to subscribe to push notifications. You will have to provide a public webhook URL and specify the events you want to subscribe to. Once you register the webhook URL, Corpay will automatically send push notifications whenever a subscribed event occurs for your client account.  
**Note**:

- You can subscribe to multiple events via the same URL.
- You can provide an HTTP URL for Beta testing. However, to enable for production you must provide a publicly accessible **HTTPS** URL.
    
- Your webhook endpoint must be configured and registered with Corpay. Any changes to the registered URL must be informed to your account representative to continue receiving the notifications.

item.name: Receive webhook notifications
item.description:
The JSON payload will contain data about the event that triggered the webhook. See [Supported Events](https://apidocscrossborder.corpay.com/#5b816dc5-6963-4ef5-93fe-690b592758d2) folder to view event payload.

### Acknowledge receipt

You must acknowledge receipt of the webhook by returning a 2xx HTTP status code. If Corpay does not get a 2xx response, it will be logged as an error and the system will attempt a retry.

### Retry

Failed webhook notifications are retried over the course of 24 hours (delayed using exponential backoff). Once the threshold is reached, the webhook call to your endpoint is disabled. Disabled notifications will not be sent. Please contact your account representative to reactivate the notifications.

item.name: Troubleshoot notifications
item.description:
**How to stop Push Notifications?**

- To stop receiving push notifications, please contact your account representative to unsubscribe from one or more webhooks events.
    

**I cannot view Subscribed Events**

If you're unable to view the events you've subscribed to

- On your request, your account representative may have disabled the notifications sent to your registered endpoints.
- If webhook notifications fail repeatedly, they are retried for up to 24 hours using exponential backoff. Once the threshold is reached, the webhook calls to your endpoint are automatically disabled.
    

**How to reactivate Unsubscribed/ Disabled notifications?**

- To reactivate unsubscribed or disabled notifications, please contact your account representative who will assist in reactivating the notifications to your endpoint.

item.name: Supported Events
Payment events

request.description: Payment event notifications sent to the registered webhook endpoint URL.

item.description:
Corpay sends push notifications for the following payment events:

| **Event** | **Description** |
| --- | --- |
| PaymentAccepted | Sent when the payment is accepted by Corpay. |
| PaymentProcessed | Sent when the Payment is acknowledged by SWIFT. |
| PaymentTrackingInfoReceived | Sent when the Payment moves within SWIFT eco-system. |
| PaymentProcessedNonSwift | Sent when Payment is acknowledged by any Non-SWIFT channel. |

**Example payment event**

``` json
{
  "EventType": "PaymentAccepted",
  "CreatedDate": "2023-03-27T10:07:01.7284746-04:00",
  "ClientCode": "252497",
  "Id": "252497-TKW7AY",
  "MessageId": "72bcfbf7-1c72-44f4-b991-8eb6f110ac8d"
}

 ```

**Response Body**

| **Parameter** | **Description** |
| --- | --- |
| EventType | The subscribed event |
| CreatedDate | The date the event was triggered |
| ClientCode | The client code |
| Id | Payment trackerId |
| MessageId | The unique message Id for the event |

You can also send a request to [/api/payment-tracking/{trackerId}](https://apidocscrossborder.corpay.com/#f12309ad-bbed-4b79-8476-038d2ff519bf) to trace the detailed information of your payment transaction.

item.name: Client Onboarding

request.description: Client onboarding event notifications sent to the registered webhook endpoint URL.

header.value: application/json, text/json, text/x-json, text/javascript, application/xml, text/xml

item.description:
Corpay sends push notifications for the following onboarding event:

| **Event** | **Description** |
| --- | --- |
| AccountApproved | Sent when the onboarding request is approved and the secret key is generated. |

**Example onboarding event**

``` json
{
  "EventType": "AccountApproved",
  "CreatedDate": "2023-06-28T14:06:07.1204513-04:00",
  "ClientCode": "308455",
  "Id": "b3f4082365bb97be3a192d0f50ab45c6",
  "MessageId": "2d552e33-b598-405b-ae9f-7f092e90164d"
}

 ```

**Response Body**

| **Parameter** | **Description** |
| --- | --- |
| EventType | The subscribed event |
| CreatedDate | The date the event was triggered |
| ClientCode | The client code |
| Id | The clientOnboardingId |
| MessageId | The unique message Id for the event |

Corpay sends webhook notifications for the following events: | **Request** | **Event** | **Status** | | --- | --- | --- | | Payment GPS | PaymentAccepted, PaymentProcessed, PaymentProcessedNonSwift, PaymentTrackingInfoReceived | Active | | Client Onboarding | AccountApproved
_Onboarding request approved and secret keys generated._ | Active | **Note**: You can currently subscribe to events that have an **Active** status. We may add new event types in the future.

Webhooks are user-defined HTTP callbacks and can be used to receive real-time updates on your transactions and their statuses. Webhooks automate the process of retrieving real-time data updates and eliminate the need to regularly poll the APIs to know if there is a new update.

### How do webhooks work?

A webhook endpoint is the URL to which you will receive subscribed event notifications. Once you register your webhook endpoint and subscribe to events, Corpay will send a real-time automated push notification to that URL whenever an event occurs for your client account. The returned JSON payload will contain the event data. You can use the notifications webhooks to monitor specific events and sync the updates with your system.

For example,

- When a payment is booked with Corpay, you can track the latest status of the payment and the complete payment journey by calling the [Payment tracking API](https://apidocscrossborder.corpay.com/#f12309ad-bbed-4b79-8476-038d2ff519bf) `GET /api/payment-tracking/{trackerId}` at regular intervals.
- With Webhooks, you can subscribe to different [payment events](https://apidocscrossborder.corpay.com/#e5703a98-504a-43f3-96dd-8319fe8d0a36). Corpay will send a push notification to your webhook endpoint via an HTTPS POST request when the subscribed event occurs without frequently polling the payment tracking API.
    

### Webhooks Security - Signature Verification

Corpay includes a unique digital signature in the header each time we send an event notification to your registered endpoint. This allows you to authenticate the payload and prevent man-in-the-middle (MITM) attacks.

- When an event occurs, the notification payload header will contain a timestamp (in Unix format) along with an encrypted key in SHA1 cryptographic hash format, created using HMAC.
- You can verify the authenticity of the notification by decrypting this header with HMAC to confirm if it matches the key.
